dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey, so Netflix, right? Like, always in the news, but especially now with earnings coming up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey, so Netflix, right? Like, always in the news, but especially now with earnings coming up.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. I mean, they're practically back at their peak levels, even after that September dip.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally. I mean, they're practically back at their peak levels, even after that September dip.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Though they took a small hit amid the broader market's September correctionafter an all-time Netflix high in late Augustshares of the Los Gatos, California-based firm are once again nearing peak levels.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's wild. And the numbers, uh, they really show just how much they've, like, dominated entertainment during the pandemic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's wild. And the numbers, uh, they really show just how much they've, like, dominated entertainment during the pandemic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Let's start with, you know, the market cap. We're talking $235 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Let's start with, you know, the market cap. We're talking two hundred thirty five billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: $235 Billion That's Netflix's market capitalization the day before it's set to release third-quarter earnings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Yeah, and that's, what, nearly a hundred billion *just this year*?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that's, what, nearly a hundred billion just this year?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It's up nearly $100 billion in 2020 alone, making the 23-year-old streaming giant one of the 20 largest companies on the S&P 500 by market cap

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Puts them in the top 20 on the S&P 500, ahead of giants like Disney and Comcast. Which is, uh, pretty wild for a company that started with DVDs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Puts them in the top twenty on the S and P five hundred, ahead of giants like Disney and Comcast. Which is, uh, pretty wild for a company that started with D V Ds.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...making the 23-year-old streaming giant one of the 20 largest companies on the S&P 500 by market capahead of even media mainstays like Walt Disney, Comcast and AT&T.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And the stock itself, I mean, it's soared over 60% this year. The S&P 500 is only up like 6.5%.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And the stock itself, I mean, it's soared over sixty percent this year. The S and P five hundred is only up like six point five percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 60% Netflix shares have soared more than 60% since the beginning of the year. To compare, the S&P 500 is up just 6.5% in 2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, huge difference. And Reed Hastings, the co-founder? He's nearly two billion dollars richer *during* the pandemic. His net worth is now, like, $5.4 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, huge difference. And Reed Hastings, the co-founder? He's nearly two billion dollars richer during the pandemic. His net worth is now, like, five point four billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The firm's billionaire cofounder and CEO, Reed Hastings, has gotten nearly $2 billion during the pandemic. The 60-year-old, who launched Netflix as a DVD subscription service in 1997 and owns roughly 1% of its shares, is now worth about $5.4 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. Okay, so, subscribers are the big one for Netflix, right? What are they expecting?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. Okay, so, subscribers are the big one for Netflix, right? What are they expecting?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Analysts are predicting 195 million paid subscribers. That's, um, up 2.5 million quarter-over-quarter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Analysts are predicting one hundred ninety five million paid subscribers. That's, um, up two point five million quarter-over-quarter.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 195 Million That's the number of paid subscribers analysts expect Netflix will report on Tuesday, up 2.5 million quarter to quarter and in line with the firm's latest guidance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, they're still growing, even after that massive surge in the first half of the year? I mean, they added 26 million then.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, they're still growing, even after that massive surge in the first half of the year? I mean, they added twenty six million then.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix said in July that it added 26 million subscribers during the first half of the year (10 million in the first quarter and nearly 16 million in the second)

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. And some research firms are even saying that might be conservative, especially with international markets bolstering them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. And some research firms are even saying that might be conservative, especially with international markets bolstering them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That increase could even prove conservative, noted investment research firm CFRA on Monday, reiterating its buy rating on Netflix shares and adding that the firm could be bolstered by an increase in subscribers from international markets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's huge. What about revenue? Are they still pulling in the big bucks?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's huge. What about revenue? Are they still pulling in the big bucks?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. Almost $6.4 billion expected for Q3, which is, uh, over 20% up from last year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. Almost six point four billion dollars expected for Q3, which is, uh, over twenty percent up from last year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: $6.4 Billion Analysts are expecting Netflix will pull nearly $6.4 billion in third-quarter revenues, up more than 20% from the same period last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, big revenue, but I saw EPS might be down a bit because of increased costs, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, big revenue, but I saw E P S might be down a bit because of increased costs, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company's also expected to report earnings of about $2.13 per share, down from $1.47 per share last year on heightened costs amid the pandemic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's what they're saying. Higher costs associated with the pandemic, which, you know, makes sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's what they're saying. Higher costs associated with the pandemic, which, you know, makes sense.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company's also expected to report earnings of about $2.13 per share, down from $1.47 per share last year on heightened costs amid the pandemic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And then the price targets... I saw Bank of America put out a really bullish one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then the price targets... I saw Bank of America put out a really bullish one.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They did! $670, which is the highest on Wall Street. They really see that H1 subscriber growth as, like, a permanent benefit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They did! six hundred seventy dollars, which is the highest on Wall Street. They really see that H1 subscriber growth as, like, a permanent benefit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: $670 That's the price target Bank of America issued on Friday for Netflix, up nearly 17% from a prior target of $575 and representing the highest Netflix price target on Wall Street. ...Bank of America said it continues to see the acceleration in Netflix subscriber growth during the first half of the year as a permanent benefit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, despite some near-term uncertainties, it sounds like Wall Street is pretty bullish on Netflix overall.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, despite some near-term uncertainties, it sounds like Wall Street is pretty bullish on Netflix overall.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. I mean, the average target is still around $527, right where they're at now, but BofA is really leaning in.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. I mean, the average target is still around five hundred twenty seven dollars, right where they're at now, but B of A is really leaning in.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix's average price target from 39 analysts covering its stock is about $527within 1% of current prices.
